description: Erection of side and rear roof extension with insertion of windows to side elevations
decision_conditions: It has not been demonstrated, on the balance of probabilities, that the cubic content of the resulting roof space of the proposed roof extensions, together with the existing roof extensions, not being part of the original house, would not exceed the cubic content of the original roof space by more than 50 cubic metres. Therefore the proposed development would fail to comply with paragraph B1.(d) (ii) of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

It has not been demonstrated, on the balance of probabilities, that the proposed erection of a side and rear roof extension with the insertion of windows in the side elevations complies with Paragraphs B.2(a) (materials) and B.2(c) (side windows) of Class B Part 1, Schedule 2, of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).
Condition 17 (Carbon Reduction Measures) - Officers have reviewed the information prepared by Hodkinson Consultancy and are satified this can now be approved.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details, as set out above are agreed and that Condition 17 (Carbon Reduction Measures) of planning permission 20/02216/CREG3 is hereby discharged subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the details hereby approved.

As of 1st May 2024, all applicants are required to submit either a 'householder checklist' in the case of householder applications, or, a 'validation checklist' in the case of all other planning applications (except for Non material amendments, prior approval applications, lawful development applications, discharge of condition(s) applications and application for works to protected trees), in accordance with the requirements of the new local validation list. The new local validation list and checklists can be obtained via the council's website- https://www.kingston.gov.uk/downloads/download/261/validation-requirements-for-planning-applications. The LPA will not conduct any validation checks until the correct checklist has been submitted. Upon receipt of a completed checklist, the application will be assigned to a validation officer to review.If you need to make any changes to your application please try to do this via the Planning Portal website where possible. If that is not possible please send amended documents via the email address quoted in this letter.
